str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
A falsehood, lie, untruthfulness. From pseudomai; a fabrication, i.e. Falsehood.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
